Medicare coverage of an end-of-life planning consultation as part of an initial preventive physical examination. Medicare coverage now includes end-of-life planning consultations, defined as discussions between a physician and individual about preparing advance directives for future health care decisions in case of incapacity. NATIONAL INFORMATION HOTLINE FOR END-OF-LIFE DECISIONMAKING AND HOSPICE CARE. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish a clearinghouse and a 24-hour toll-free hotline to provide consumer information on advance directives, end-of-life decision-making, and hospice care services. This will be funded through grants, contracts, or interagency agreements. The Administrator may designate an existing clearinghouse and 24-hour toll-free telephone hotline or establish a new one if necessary. Increasing awareness of end-of-life planning by adding a new part to the Public Health Service Act, which includes programs to increase awareness of advance directive planning issues through education campaigns. The Secretary will conduct a national public education campaign to raise awareness about planning for care near the end of life, improve understanding of health care wishes, and emphasize the importance of advance directives. The Secretary will allocate funds for grants to public or nonprofit entities for education campaigns on hospice and palliative care.
